H0.text: Evaporation of moisture is greatest where it is hot and sunny.

H1.text: Cool and snowy conditions are where evaporation of moisture is greatest.

H2.text: Sunny and populated is where evaporation of moisture is greatest.

H3.text: Rainy and hot conditions are where evaporation of moisture is greatest.

A4.text: The higher the temperature of the substance the greater the kinetic energy of the molecules at its surface and therefore the faster the rate of their evaporation.

A5.text: Evaporation is an essential part of the water cycle. The sun (solar energy) drives evaporation of water from oceans, lakes, moisture in the soil, and other sources of water.
